elements.name: question1
rows: With the apprenticeship contract, the training company undertakes to provide the apprentice with professional training for a specific occupation.
The apprenticeship contract must be concluded in writing and approved by the competent cantonal authority.
Anyone who has not yet reached the age of 18 can also sign the apprenticeship contract alone.
The training company only owes a 13th month's salary if this has been agreed.
An apprenticeship contract can be terminated at any time without special reasons with a notice period of three months.
Unless the parties agree otherwise, a probationary period of three months applies to the apprenticeship contract.
During the probationary period, the apprenticeship can be terminated at any time with a notice period of fourteen days.
At the end of the probationary period, the apprenticeship can only be terminated for good cause and without notice.
The training company must give the apprentice time off for the final apprenticeship examinations without deducting wages.
elements.title: Are the statements about the apprenticeship contract correct or incorrect?
